messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:23): "Mark as read" on 500 emails feels good.
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:23): disgusting
c72bc9838a34ceed0fc01ade7fd33499 (00:23): But... but... you didn't read them!
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:23): it's only 23:20, I'm sure you could read them all before bed :p
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:24): I don't read everything on help mailing lists!
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:24): If you lie to your mail client like that, how do I know you're not going to lie to me? :-(
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:24): You sir, need mail filters
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:24): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: I have mail filters.
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:24): oh ho, so it's not 500 emails in your inbox :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:24): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: Hell no, my inbox is almost always at zero unread.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:25): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: It's mainly css-d, thelist, MySQL General Discussion and such like which are unread

c72bc9838a34ceed0fc01ade7fd33499 (00:25): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: At that point, why not just delete them and go to the list archives? Are you maintaining your own personal archive of each list?

150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:26): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: is it just me or does http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#concept-error-nothandled not point to the right place?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:26): c72bc9838a34ceed0fc01ade7fd33499: Because then I have the hassle of resubscribing whenever I want to ask a question.
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:26): it's one line below http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#report-the-error
c72bc9838a34ceed0fc01ade7fd33499 (00:26): No, I mean deleting older messages, keeping your subscription to the list.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:26): c72bc9838a34ceed0fc01ade7fd33499: Oh, no reason
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:26): c72bc9838a34ceed0fc01ade7fd33499: Disk space is cheap
c72bc9838a34ceed0fc01ade7fd33499 (00:27): Heh. Fair enough.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:27): (Actually, that's not true, when dealing with quick 2.5" HDs disk space is fairly expensive, but I have bigger issues than email)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:28): Disk space is really cheap until you've got one byte more data than you have storage, and then it's really expensive
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:28): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: you can totally have asubscription and instruct it not to send you messages.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:29): (though "really expensive" is relative to e.g. a packet of chocolate biscuits, rather than to e.g. a house)
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:29): and then you add P.S. please cc
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:29): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: That means remembering :)
eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2 (00:29): I mean, what mailman really should do is let you send only conversations that you care about :-)

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:29): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: see http://www.flickr.com/photos a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554/2185019213/ and http://www.flickr.com/photos a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554/2185803994/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:30): eca88ce0deea1275223afe139b2595e2: That's really out of date, I have more mailboxes than that now :)
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:30): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: er, I guess it is pointing to the right place (first mention?), but I don't see a definition there
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:30): 150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64: Can you click the term to see a list of all the places it's mentioned?
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:32): oh, is http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#dfnReturnLink-0 the definition?
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:32): I guess so
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:32): That URL isn't going to work very well over IRC
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:33): It's a locally-generated fragment ID
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:33): huh? the page results are non-deterministic?/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:34): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e wrote it. Don't assume it will be.
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:34): (why is it locally generated to begin with?)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:34): 150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64: Because 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e told me to write the script to do it on the server, and I haven't written it yet.

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:35): 150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64: I think the idea is that when you click a use of a definition, it jumps to the use by giving it a locally-generated ID (because normally it's just an <a href> without an id)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:42): 150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64: the definition is the bold word that says "not handled"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:42): 150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64: it's just a constant. It could say "after which the error is either grapefruit or pineapple:"
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:44): that's not what I'd call a definition
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (00:45): but I get it now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:51): i agree that it's not really a definition. not sure what the definition would be though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:51): it's like "true" and "False"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:07): wow, talk about preaching to the choir http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-rdf-in-xhtml-tf/2009Jul/0127.html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:07): steven pemberton is now lecuring _me_ on the "real world" and following what browsers do
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:07): how the world has changed
